p:
Climate change has direct and indirect effects on birds
10 and migratory species are particularly sensitive. Notably, altered climatic conditions can modify migratory phenologies
11, 12 and result in shifting wintering and/or breeding areas, with consequences for migratory distances
3, 13 . Global changes may even result in species/populations switching from a migratory to a resident strategy, and vice versa
3, 14 .
